OptionDisplayGroup.name: groupCommonOres
OptionDisplayGroup.Description: Distribution options for Common Ores Ores.

OptionChoice.name: enableCommonOres
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle Common Ores ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle Common Ores ores.
Common Ores ores will be handled by the mod itself.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpCommonOres
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of Common Ores ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up Common Ores ores.
Common Ores ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

Choice.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.
Simulates Vanilla Minecraft.

Choice.description: Silver is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: cmorSilverFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Common Ores Silver distributions

OptionNumeric.name: cmorSilverSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Common Ores Silver distributions

OptionChoice.name: cmorMountainSilverDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Mountain Silver is generated

Choice.description: Mountain Silver is not generated in the world.

Substitute.name: cmorOverworldBlockSubstitute0
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Veins.name: cmorSilverVeins
Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

Cloud.name: cmorSilverCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.

Veins.name: cmorSilverHintVeins
Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: cmorSilverStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.
